trans-unit.source: Exercise – Process a Rent Order with Non-Cascaded Scale Price

seg-source.mrk: Exercise – Process a Rent Order with Non-Cascaded Scale Price

trans-unit.source: Customer R-40000 signed an agreement to rent item R-40000-02 for at least six months starting February 1, 2019. While this item typically rents for 500 per month, the agreement states that as long as the rental exceeds five months, the price is 485 per month. You set up a new pricing structure for this customer and then process the Rent Order, to be prepaid every three months.

seg-source.mrk: Customer R-40000 signed an agreement to rent item R-40000-02 for at least six months starting February 1, 2019.
While this item typically rents for 500 per month, the agreement states that as long as the rental exceeds five months, the price is 485 per month.
You set up a new pricing structure for this customer and then process the Rent Order, to be prepaid every three months.

trans-unit.source: Set Up the Price Structure

seg-source.mrk: Set Up the Price Structure

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to set up the price structure:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to set up the price structure:

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the work date is 01/26/19.

seg-source.mrk: Ensure that the work date is 01/26/19.

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane, click cc|rental > Contract Management > Items.

seg-source.mrk: In the navigation pane, click cc|rental > Contract Management > Items.

trans-unit.source: Locate item R-40000-02 and then click Navigate > Prices (in the Rental group).

seg-source.mrk: Locate item R-40000-02 and then click Navigate > Prices (in the Rental group).

trans-unit.source:
In the Rental Prices page, enter the following:
  1. Sales Type = All Customers
  2. Unit of Measure Code = PCS
  3. Rental Rate Code = MONTH
  4. Unit Price = 500

seg-source.mrk: In the Rental Prices page, enter the following:
• Sales Type = All Customers
• Unit of Measure Code = PCS
• Rental Rate Code = MONTH
• Unit Price = 500

trans-unit.source:
Go to the next line and enter the following:
  1. Sales Types = Customer
  2. Sales Code = R-40000
  3. Unit of Measure Code = PCS
  4. Rental Rate Code = MONTH
  5. Minimum Qty. Rate Units = 5
  6. Unit Price = 485

seg-source.mrk: Go to the next line and enter the following:<ol start="1">
• Sales Types = Customer
• Sales Code = R-40000
• Unit of Measure Code = PCS
• Rental Rate Code = MONTH
<li class="ccTextvorlageNumberedList">Minimum Qty.
Rate Units = 5
• Unit Price = 485

trans-unit.source: : Rental prices for non-cascaded scale price

seg-source.mrk: : Rental prices for non-cascaded scale price

trans-unit.source: Click OK to close the Rental Prices page.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to close the Rental Prices page.

trans-unit.source: Create the Rent Order

seg-source.mrk: Create the Rent Order

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create the rent order:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to create the rent order:

trans-unit.source: Insert a new rent order for customer R-40000.

seg-source.mrk: Insert a new rent order for customer R-40000.

trans-unit.source:
On the first line of the Lines FastTab, enter the following:
  1. Type = Item
  2. No. = R-40000-02
  3. Quantity = 1
  4. Rental Rate Code = Month
  5. Prepaid = Yes
  6. Rental Start Date = 02/01/19
  7. Rental End Date = 05/31/19

seg-source.mrk: On the first line of the Lines FastTab, enter the following:
• Type = Item
<li class="ccTextvorlageNumberedList">No.
• Quantity = 1
• Rental Rate Code = Month
• Prepaid = Yes
• Rental Start Date = 02/01/19
• Rental End Date = 05/31/19

trans-unit.source:
Notice that the standard pricing is used because only four months were included in the invoicing period:
  1. Rate Unit Price = 500
  2. Total No. of Rate Units = 4

seg-source.mrk: Notice that the standard pricing is used because only four months were included in the invoicing period:<ol start="1">
• Rate Unit Price = 500
<li class="ccTextvorlageNumberedList">Total No.
of Rate Units = 4

trans-unit.source: : Standard pricing used when number of rate units not met

seg-source.mrk: : Standard pricing used when number of rate units not met

trans-unit.source: Change the Rental End Date to 07/31/19.

seg-source.mrk: Change the Rental End Date to 07/31/19.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the agreement pricing of 485 is used because the total number of rate units equal or exceed five.

seg-source.mrk: Notice that the agreement pricing of 485 is used because the total number of rate units equal or exceed five.

trans-unit.source: : Agreement pricing used when number of rate units are met

seg-source.mrk: : Agreement pricing used when number of rate units are met

trans-unit.source: Process the Invoices

seg-source.mrk: Process the Invoices

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to process the invoices:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to process the invoices:

trans-unit.source: On the Lines FastTab, click Line > Item Tracking Lines.

seg-source.mrk: On the Lines FastTab, click Line > Item Tracking Lines.

trans-unit.source: With the Shipment option selected, click OK.

seg-source.mrk: With the Shipment option selected, click OK.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Select Entries and then click OK.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Select Entries and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to close the Item Tracking Lines page.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to close the Item Tracking Lines page.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post.

trans-unit.source: With the Ship option selected, click OK.

seg-source.mrk: With the Ship option selected, click OK.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Post.

trans-unit.source: Click the Invoice option and then click OK.

seg-source.mrk: Click the Invoice option and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: In the Posting Date field, enter 02/01/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Posting Date field, enter 02/01/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 04/30/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 04/30/19.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

trans-unit.source: Open the invoice and notice that the agreement pricing is used on all lines.

seg-source.mrk: Open the invoice and notice that the agreement pricing is used on all lines.

trans-unit.source: : First invoice with agreement pricing

seg-source.mrk: : First invoice with agreement pricing

trans-unit.source: Post the invoice and then escape back to the Rent Order.

seg-source.mrk: Post the invoice and then escape back to the Rent Order.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Home > Post.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Home > Post.

trans-unit.source: Click the Invoice option and then click OK.

seg-source.mrk: Click the Invoice option and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: In the Posting Date field, enter 05/01/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Posting Date field, enter 05/01/19.

trans-unit.source: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 07/31/19.

seg-source.mrk: In the Invoice to Date field, enter 07/31/19.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to create the invoice and then accept all confirmation messages.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Invoices.

trans-unit.source: Open the invoice and notice that the agreement pricing is used on all lines.

seg-source.mrk: Open the invoice and notice that the agreement pricing is used on all lines.

trans-unit.source: : Second invoice with agreement pricing

seg-source.mrk: : Second invoice with agreement pricing
